intro: Limnonesis commutata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water lily, is a species of aquatic plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Nymphaeaceae and is characterized by its broad, floating leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and lakes. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a waxy surface to reduce water loss, while its flowers are often pink or white. Limnonesis commutata plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
